flawed_nl_solution:
1/3rd of the workers before the new hires were women because 1 - (2/3) = 1/3
There were 30 women working for the company before the new hires
There are now 40 women working for the company because 30 + 10 = <<30+10=40>>40
There are 120 people working for the company because 90 + 10 = <<90+10=120>>120
The proportion of women working in the company is 1/3 because 40 / 120 = <<40/120=1/3>>1/3
The percentage of women working in the company is now 100/3 because 1/3 x 100 = <<1/3*100=100/3>>100/3
#### 100/3

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 100, not 120. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
